1183.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1143.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Nursing homes.
   (b)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
   (c)   Charitable, fraternal and social organizations.
   (d)   Garden apartments.
   (e)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (f)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1143.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Minimum required for all uses not otherwise listed:
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be seven thousand five
hundred (7,500) square feet.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be sixty (60) feet.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty (40) feet from the street
right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than six (6) feet
each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
      (5)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (6)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
   (b)   Minimum required for single-family semi-detached dwellings:
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be five thousand (5,000)
square feet for each dwelling unit.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be forty (40) feet for each
dwelling unit.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. the minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty (40) feet from the street
right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than eight (8) feet
each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
      (5)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (6)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
         (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
   (c)   Minimum required for single-family attached dwellings and single-
family attached quad dwellings: (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be three thousand (3,000)
square feet for each dwelling unit.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be twenty (20) feet for each
dwelling unit.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty (40) feet from the street
right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. The minimum side yard for end units shall equal a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than twenty (20)
feet each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
            (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (5)   Screening. Where a proposed single-family attached dwelling or
single-family attached quad dwelling development abuts a lot containing a
single-family detached dwelling or single-family semi-detached dwelling,
screening shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning
Code along side and rear lot lines.
         (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (6)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (7)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
      (8)   Active Play Area. In addition to the required lot area and yards,
one hundred fifty (150) square feet of active play area per dwelling unit shall
be provided. (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (9)   Number of Units.For single-family attached dwellings, no less than
three (3) and no more than eight (8) dwellings shall be permitted in a unit or
group. (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
   (d)   Minimum required for multi-family structures or garden apartments:
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be two thousand five
hundred (2,500) square feet per dwelling unit.
      (2)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. The minimum side yard setback shall be fifty (50)
feet from property boundary lines. The minimum distance between principal
buildings shall be sixty (60) feet.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard setback shall be fifty (50) feet
from property boundary lines. (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (3)   Screening. Where a proposed garden apartment development abuts a
lot containing a single-family detached dwelling or single-family semi-detached
dwelling, screening shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this
Zoning Code along side and rear lot lines.
         (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (4)   Height. The maximum building height shall be three stories, not
exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (5)   Length. The maximum building length shall not exceed one hundred
fifty (150) feet.
      (6)   Active Play Area. In addition to the required lot area and yards,
two hundred (200) square feet of active play area per dwelling unit shall be
provided.
      (7)   Number of Units. The maximum number of dwelling units permitted
shall be determined on the basis of two thousand five hundred (2,500) square
feet of lot area per dwelling unit, exclusive of public rights-of-way.
1143.05 ARCHITECTURAL CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "R-2A" District shall provide
buildings of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible
with adjacent uses in scale, proportion, design and materials.
1143.06 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   Off-street parking shall be provided in accordance with the following
requirements:
   (a)   For each single-family detached dwelling and single-family semi-
detached dwelling there shall be provided in a private garage or driveway, at
least two (2) off-street parking space for each dwelling unit.   
   (b)   For single-family attached dwellings, single-family attached quad
dwellings, and garden apartments, off-street parking shall be provided for each
dwelling unit as follows:
 
NO. OF BEDROOMS    MINIMUM NO. OF PARKING SPACES
Efficiency Unit    1.5
1 Bedroom          2.0
2 Bedrooms         2.5
3 or More Bedrooms 3.0
   
The total number of parking spaces shall be rounded up to the next whole number
where a fractional total would result.
   (c)    For all other buildings and uses, compliance with the off-street
parking regulations set forth in Chapter
1185 shall be required.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
CHAPTER 1145

1185.42
 
 
1145.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "R-3" District is to accommodate high density residential
uses of an urban character. This district is designed for those persons who
desire to reside in an area which fulfills a variety of housing needs typically
found in the area surrounding the City's urban core. This district should
generally apply to that area of the City adjacent to the Central Business
District and not to lands annexed by the City after the effective date of this
chapter.
1145.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "R-3" High Density Residential
District:
   (a)   Single-family detached dwellings.
   (b)   Single-family semi-detached dwellings.
   (c)   Single family attached dwellings.
   (d)   Apartment buildings
   (e)   Conversion apartments and two-family detached dwellings.
   (f)   Type A child day care homes in single-family detached dwellings.
   (g)   Adult family homes and community alternative homes in single-family
detached dwellings.
   (h)   Boarding and rooming houses in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (i)   Bed and breakfast establishments and dormitories in accordance with
the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (j)   Residential home facilities in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (k)   Garage apartments in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (l)   Home occupations in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 1185.
   (m)   Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to a permitted
principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (n)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (o)   Planned Unit Developments in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1183.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1145.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Nursing homes.
   (b)   Emergency shelters.
   (c)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
   (d)   Charitable, fraternal and social organizations.
   (e)   Professional services as listed in the "B-5" Neighborhood Commercial
District.
   (f)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (g)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1145.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   Minimum required for all uses:
   (a)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be four thousand (4,000)
square feet for single-family detached dwellings and single-family semi-
detached dwellings. For each dwelling unit over two, there shall be at least
five hundred (500) square feet of additional lot area.
   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance fifteen (15) feet
back from the street right-of-way line shall be forty (40) feet for single-
family detached dwellings and single-family semi-detached dwellings. For each
dwelling unit over two, there shall be at least four (4) feet of additional lot
width.
   (c)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
fifteen (15) feet from the street right-of- way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be more than thirty-five (35) feet.
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided of not less than four
(4) feet each. Buildings of three or more stories shall have six (6) feet
additional for each side yard for each story over two.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be twenty-five (25) feet.
   (d)   Screening. Where a proposed townhouse, multi-family, or non-
residential use abuts a lot containing a single- family detached dwelling or
single-family semi-detached dwelling, screening shall be provided by the
property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along side and rear lot lines.
   (e)   Height. The maximum building height shall be seven stories, not
exceeding one hundred (100) feet in height.
   (f)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to comply with the
following requirements:
      (1)   The minimum width of a corner lot at a distance fifteen (15) feet
back from the street right-of-way line shall be fifty (50) feet.
      (2)   The minimum side yard on the side facing the side street shall be
ten (10) feet wide.
1145.05  ARCHITECTURAL CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "R-3" District shall provide buildings
of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible with adjacent
uses in scale, proportion, design and materials.
1145.06 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   Off-street parking shall be provided in accordance with the following
requirements:
   (a)   For each single-family detached dwelling and single-family semi-
detached dwelling there shall be provided in a private garage or driveway, at
least one (1) off-street parking space for each dwelling unit.
   (b)   For single-family attached dwellings, conversion apartments or two-
family detached dwellings, and apartments, off-street parking shall be provided
for each dwelling unit as follows:
 
NO. OF BEDROOMS    MINIMUM NO. OF PARKING SPACES
Efficiency Unit    1.0
1 Bedroom          1.5
2 Bedrooms         2.0
3 or More Bedrooms 2.5
      The total number of parking spaces shall be rounded up to the next whole
number where a fractional total would result.
   (c)   For all other buildings and uses, compliance with the off-street
parking regulations set forth in Chapter
1185 shall be required.
      (Ord. 2011-20. Passed 10-11-11.)

1147.01  APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "R-3A" District is to accommodate high density
residential uses. This district is designed for those persons who desire to
reside in an area which provides a variety of housing types typically found in
a suburban area, and usually strongly highway oriented or near regional
shopping complexes. This district should apply to undeveloped tracts of land
and to those lands annexed by the City after the effective date of this
chapter.
1147.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "R-3A" High Density Residential
District:
   (a)   Single-family detached dwellings.
   (b)   Single-family semi-detached dwellings.
   (c)   Single family attached dwellings.
   (d)   Garden Apartments.
   (e)   Type A child day care homes in single-family detached dwellings.

detached dwellings.

Chapter
1185.
   (h)   Home occupations in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (i)   Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to a permitted
principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (j)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (k)   Planned Unit Developments in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1183.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1147.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Nursing homes.
   (b)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
   (c)   Charitable, fraternal and social organizations.
   (d)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (e)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1147.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Minimum required for all uses not otherwise listed:
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be five thousand (5,000)
square feet.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be fifty (50) feet.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty (40) feet from the street
right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than five (5) feet
each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
      (5)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (6)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
   (b)   Minimum required for single-family semi-detached dwellings:
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be four thousand (4,000)
square feet for each dwelling unit.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be thirty (30) feet for each
dwelling unit.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line. Where a front yard
setback line has been established by existing residences in the block, this
line shall be followed, provided that in no case shall the front yard setback
be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty (40) feet from the street
right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than six (6) feet
each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
      (5)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (6)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
         (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
   (c)   Minimum required for single-family attached dwellings and single-
family attached quad dwellings: (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be two thousand five
hundred (2,500) square feet for each dwelling unit.
      (2)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of- way line shall be eighteen (18) feet for
each dwelling unit.
      (3)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100)
feet.
      (4)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be twenty-five
(25) feet. Where a front yard setback line has been established by existing
residences in the block, this line shall be followed, provided that in no case
shall the front yard setback be less than twenty (20) feet nor more than forty
(40) feet from the street right- of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. The minimum side yard for end units shall equal a
minimum of ten (10) percent of the lot width, but not less than twenty (20)
feet each.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
            (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (5)   Screening. Where a proposed single-family attached dwelling or
single-family attached quad dwelling development abuts a lot containing a
single-family detached dwelling or single-family semi-detached dwelling,
screening shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning
Code along side and rear lot lines.
         (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (6)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half
stories, not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (7)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
         (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (8)   Active Play Area. Active play area shall be furnished in single-
family attached dwelling or single-family attached quad dwelling development
projects containing more than eighteen (18) dwelling units or more than three
(3) principal structures containing at least four (4) dwelling units each. Such
area shall be in addition to the required lot area and yards, and shall be not
less than two thousand (2,000) square feet in land area, nor less than thirty
(30) feet in its smallest dimension. For each dwelling unit in excess of the
minimum number prescribed above, an additional one hundred (100) square feet of
area per dwelling unit shall be allocated to the total active play area.
      (9)   Number of Units. For single-family attached dwellings, no less than
three (3) and no more than eight (8) dwellings shall be permitted in a unit or
group.
   (d)   Minimum required for garden apartments:
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (1)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be two thousand (2,000)
square feet per dwelling unit.
      (2)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
         A.   Front Yard. The minimum front yard setback shall be at least
twenty-five (25) feet from the street right-of-way line.
         B.   Side Yards. The minimum side yard setback shall be twenty (20)
feet from property boundary lines. The minimum distance between principal
buildings shall be forty (40) feet.
         C.   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard setback shall be thirty (30)
feet from property boundary lines.
            (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (3)   Screening. Where a proposed garden apartment development abuts a
lot containing a single-family detached dwelling or single-family semi-detached
dwelling, screening shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this
Zoning Code along side and rear lot lines.
         (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (4)   Height. The maximum building height shall be three stories, not
exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
      (5)   Length. The maximum building length shall not exceed one hundred
fifty (150) feet. (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
      (6)   Active Play Area. In addition to the required lot area and yards,
active play area per dwelling unit shall be provided as follows:
   
NO. OF BEDROOMS    MINIMUM PLAY AREA
Efficiency Unit    75 square feet
1 Bedroom          100 square feet
2 Bedrooms         125 square feet
3 or More Bedrooms 150 square feet
 
         Where any garden apartment project is proposed to be developed in
conjunction with single-family attached dwellings or single-family attached
quad dwellings, as set forth in Section
1147.04(c) above, the active play area shall be designed for and made
accessible to residents of all dwelling types in the mixed use development.
         (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
      (7)   Number of Units. The maximum number of dwelling units permitted
shall be determined on the basis of two thousand (2,000) square feet of lot
area per dwelling unit, exclusive of public rights-of-way.
         (Ord. 1996-12. Passed 4-2-96.)
1147.05 ARCHITECTURAL CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "R-3A" District shall provide
buildings of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible
with adjacent uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. (Ord. 1996-12.
Passed 4-2-96.)
1147.06  OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   Off-street parking shall be provided in accordance with the following
requirements:
   (a)   For each single-family detached dwelling and single-family semi-
detached dwelling there shall be provided in a private garage or driveway, at
least two (2) off-street parking space for each dwelling unit.
   (b)   For single-family attached dwellings, single-family attached quad
dwellings and garden apartments, off-street parking shall be provided for each
dwelling unit as follows:
 
NO. OF BEDROOMS    MINIMUM NO. OF PARKING SPACES
Efficiency Unit    1.5
1 Bedroom          2.0
2 Bedrooms         2.5
3 or More Bedrooms 3.0
 
The total number of parking spaces shall be rounded up to the next whole number
where a fractional total would result.
   (c)   For all other buildings and uses, compliance with the off-street
parking regulations set forth in Chapter
1185 shall be required.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
CHAPTER 1148
“R-4" Residential and Commercial District
1148.01   Application of district.
1148.02   Permitted uses for contributing structures.
1148.03   Permitted uses for non-contributing structures.
1148.04   Conditional uses.
1148.05   Area, frontage, height and yard regulations.

CROSS REFERENCES
H Historic District - see P. & Z. Ch.
1177
 
 
1148.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the “R-4" District is to facilitate the preservation and
stabilization of historic districts designated pursuant to the provisions of
Chapter
1177 of this Zoning Code, which are primarily residential in character, by
offering greater opportunities for the use and reuse of historic properties.
The District makes the distinction between contributing and non-contributing
structures as defined in this Zoning Code. This District differs from the “H”
Historic District in that it is a base district rather than an overlay
district. Compliance with the provisions of Chapter
1177 of the Zoning Code shall be required for all properties in this District.
(Ord. 1999-10. Passed 3-16-99.)
1148.02 PERMITTED USES FOR CONTRIBUTING STRUCTURES.
   The following uses are permitted for contributing structures in the "R-4"
Residential and Commercial District:
   (a)   Single-family detached dwellings.
   (b)   Single-family semi-detached dwellings.
   (c)   Retail businesses, including: antique shops; art galleries or artist
studios; bakeries; candy or ice cream sales; bath and skin care products; book,
magazine, and newspaper sales; greeting card and stationary sales; china and
glassware sales; candle and gift shops; apparel shops; hobby or craft shops;
florist or plant shops; cybercafés; jewelry sales; musical instrument sales;
toy stores; restaurants, but not bars or taverns; upholstery/interior design
services; and other similar retail uses; but excluding establishments designed
to provide through facilities.
   (d)   Business and professional services, including: accountant, architect,
attorney, engineer or surveyor offices; data processing; debt collection
services; public relations and management consulting services; recording or
sound studios; medical offices or clinics; copying or printing services;
mortgage, investment and financial planning services; real estate and insurance
offices; and other similar business and professional service uses; but
excluding establishments designed to provide through facilities.
   (e)   Personal services, including: barber shops and beauty salons; nail
salons and tanning studios; child day care centers; photography studios and
photo shops; dance or gymnastic studios; music studios; dry cleaning and
laundry services; photography studios and photo shops; commercial wedding
chapels; karate studios; travel agencies; and other similar personal service
uses; but excluding establishments designed to provide through facilities.
   (f)   Conversion apartments and two-family detached dwellings.
   (g)   Type A child day care homes in single-family detached dwellings.
   (h)   Adult family homes and community alternative homes in single-family
detached dwellings.
   (i)   Boarding and rooming houses in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (j)   Funeral homes.
   (k)    Bed and breakfast establishments in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (l)   Residential home facilities in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (m)    Garage apartments in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (n)   Home occupations in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (o)    Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to a permitted
principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1148.03 PERMITTED USES FOR NON-CONTRIBUTING STRUCTURES.
   The following uses are permitted for non-contributing structures in the "R-
4" Residential and Commercial District:
   (a)   Single-family detached dwellings.
   (b)   Single-family semi-detached dwellings.
   (c)   Conversion apartments and two-family detached dwellings.
   (d)   Type A child day care homes in single-family detached dwellings.
   (e)    Boarding and rooming houses in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185
   (f)   Residential home facilities in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (g)   Garage apartments in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (h)   Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to a permitted
principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1148.04 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted for contributing or non-contributing
structures, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions which shall take
into consideration the public health, safety and welfare, and the comfort and
convenience of the general public and residents of the immediate neighborhood,
as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Single-family attached dwellings.
   (b)   Apartment buildings.
   (c)   Schools, libraries or museums.
   (d)   Clubs, lodges and community centers.
   (e)   Charitable, fraternal and social organizations.
   (f)   For non-contributing buildings, retail businesses, business and
professional services, and personal services as listed in Section
1148.02 (c), (d) and (e) of this Chapter.
   (g)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (h)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1148.05 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   The following is required for all uses:
   (a)   Lot area, lot width, front, side or rear yard building setbacks and
height requirements shall be determined by the Historic Landmarks Commission
with primary consideration given to the preservation needs of structures and
surrounding properties in accordance with Section
1148.06.
   (b)   Screening as defined in the Zoning Code may be required by the
Historic Landmarks Commission.
      (Ord. 1999-10. Passed 3-16-99.)
1148.06 ARCHITECTURAL CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the “R-4" District shall be required to
comply with the Secretary of the Interior’s Standards for Rehabilitation and
the design guidelines adopted by the Historic Landmarks Commission in
accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1177 of this Zoning Code. In order to ensure that the integrity of the interior
space is maintained in a contributing structure, the following shall be
required for all interior modifications:
   (a)   No interior modification shall be injurious to the architectural or
historic character of the structure.
   (b)   The integrity and arrangement of existing interior spaces must be
maintained and all rooms shall be part of the primary residential structure and
shall not be specifically constructed, reconstructed or altered for other
purposes unless approved by the Historic Landmarks Commission.
   (c)   All interior modifications shall be described in an application for a
certificate of appropriateness, which shall be subject to review and approval
by this Historic Landmarks Commission.
      (Ord. 1999-10. Passed 3-16-99.)
1148.07 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements in this District shall be the same as
those for the “R-3" District, however, alternative parking regulations may be
applied in accordance with Section
1185.27 of this Zoning Code.
(Ord. 1999-10. Passed 3-16-99.)

1185.19
Shopping centers - see P. & Z.
1185.39
Signs - see P. & Z.
1185.40
 
 
1149.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-1" District is to accommodate development in the
traditional core business area of the City. This district is designed to
perpetuate the mix of activities which reflect commercial uses of an urban
character. This district should not apply to lands outside the City's core
business area or to lands annexed by the City after the effective date of this
chapter.
1149.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "B-1" Central Business District:
   (a)   Residential dwelling units, including efficiency dwelling units on or
above the second floor level from the ground.
   (b)   Retail businesses, including amusement arcades; antique shops; apparel
shops; appliance sales; art galleries or artist studios; auction rooms;
automobile supply stores; bakeries; bars or taverns; beer, wine and liquor
sales; billiard or pool halls; book, magazine, and newspaper sales; candy or
ice cream sales; carpet and rug sales; candle and gift shops; china and
glassware sales; cybercafés; drug stores; florist or plant shops; farmers
markets; flea markets; furniture sales; greeting card and stationary sales;
grocery stores; hardware stores; hobby or craft shops; jewelry sales; medical
equipment supply stores; motion picture and stage theaters; musical instrument
sales; paint and wallpaper stores; pawnshops; pet shops and pet supply stores;
photo shops; snack bars/snack shops; tobacco products sales; toy stores;
restaurants; sporting goods stores; upholstery/interior design services; used
merchandise stores; video arcades; and other similar retail uses; including
sidewalk sales and sidewalk vendor stands, but excluding establishments
designed to provide through facilities.
   (c)   Business and professional services, including: accountant, architect,
attorney, engineer or surveyor offices; banks, credit unions, savings and loan
companies, and other financial services; commercial printing/publishing; data
processing; debt collection services; public relations and management
consulting services; massage and physical therapy establishments; office supply
and equipment sales; photocopying shops; radio and television stations;
recording or sound studios; medical offices or clinics; mortgage, investment
and real estate and insurance offices; and other similar business and
professional service uses; but excluding establishments designed to provide
through facilities.
   (d)   Personal services, including: bail bondsmen, barber shops and beauty
salons; body piercing establishments; fortune tellers, psychics or astrologers;
health/sports clubs; nail salons and tanning studios; child day care centers;
funeral homes; laundromats; photography studios and photo shops; dance or
gymnastic studios; music studios; dry cleaning and laundry pick up and
services; commercial wedding chapels; karate studios; tattoo establishments;
travel agencies; tuxedo rental; and other similar personal service uses; but
excluding establishments designed to provide through facilities.
   (e)   Repair and rental services, including: carpenter, electrician,
locksmith and plumbing shops; furniture rental; and the repair, rental and
servicing of any article the sale of which is a permitted use in this district.
   (f)   Assembling, finishing, cleaning or other processing of products which
is clearly incidental to a permitted retail or service business, where goods so
processed are to be sold exclusively on the premises, provided the total area
devoted to such activities does not exceed one-third (1/3) of the total gross
floor area devoted to the retail or service use.
   (g)   Hotels and conference centers.
   (h)   Office buildings, business offices and administrative offices for
charitable, fraternal, governmental and social organizations.
   (i)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
   (j)   Trade or vocational schools.
   (k)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (l)   Signs but not billboards, in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (m)    Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to a permitted
principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (n)    Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1149.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Automobile, motorcycle, snowmobile or all-purpose vehicle sales and
rental.
   (b)   Minor automobile repair, automobile tire shops and oil change
facilities.
   (c)   Bus terminals and shelters.
   (d)   Drive through facilities
   (e)   Emergency shelters.
   (f)   Gas station minimarts and gasoline service stations.
   (g)   Parking structures, public and commercial parking lots.
   (h)   Railroad or bus passenger stations.
   (i)   Commercial indoor recreation facilities.
   (j)   Sidewalk cafes.
   (k)   Taxi services.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1149.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   No area, frontage or yard regulations shall apply except for a lot
which abuts a residential district. In this case, there shall be a front yard
applicable to the business lot of ten (10) feet or one-half the average front
yard of the nearest residence in the adjoining residential district, whichever
is greater. However, in no case need this front yard be more than twenty (20)
feet.
   (b)   Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening shall be
provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along side and
rear lot lines.
   (c)   The maximum building height shall be twelve stories, not exceeding one
hundred fifty (150) feet in height.
1149.05 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements in Section
1185.29 of this Zoning Code shall not apply in the "B-1" Central Business
District, however all other off-street parking requirements contained in
Section
1185.29 shall be applicable where off-street parking is provided.
(Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
CHAPTER 1151
"B-2" Community Commercial District
1151.01   Application of district.
1151.02   Permitted uses.
1151.03   Conditional uses.

 1185.40
 
 
1151.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-2" District is to accommodate intensive commercial
activities which generate high levels of vehicular traffic. This district is
designed for those commercial facilities which are strongly highway oriented
and which prefer maximum exposure to the traveling public. This district should
not generally apply to lands annexed by the City after the effective date of
this chapter.
1151.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "B-2" Community Commercial District:
   (a)   All uses as permitted and regulated in the "R-2" Medium Density
Residential District.
   (b)   Retail businesses, business and professional services, personal
services, and repair and rental services, as listed in the "B-1" Central
Business District.
   (c)   Mixed use developments and mixed use dwellings.
   (d)   Neighborhood and community shopping centers in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (e)   Automobile, motorcycle, snowmobile or all-purpose vehicle sales and
rental.
   (f)   Minor automobile repair, automobile tire shops, automobile wash/
detailing and oil change facilities.
   (g)   Convenience stores, gas station mini-marts and gasoline service
stations.
   (h)   Boat and recreational vehicle sales and rental.
   (i)   Garden centers or garden supply stores, nurseries and commercial
greenhouses.
   (j)   Equipment sales and rental.
   (k)   Emergency medical service organizations.
   (l)   Commercial indoor recreation facilities.
   (m)   Manufactured home sales.
   (n)   Recycling collection points and donation collection bins.
   (o)   Hotels, motels and conference centers.
   (p)   Fast food restaurants with or without a drive through facility.
   (q)   Office buildings, business offices and administrative offices for
charitable, fraternal, governmental and social organizations.
   (r)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
   (s)   Trade or vocational schools, and other instructional studios.
   (t)   Day spas.
   (u)   Small engine repair.
   (v)   Pet grooming and veterinary clinics, but not kennels.
   (w)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (x)   Signs but not billboards in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (y)   Repair and rental services, including: carpenter, electrician,
locksmith and plumbing shops; furniture rental; and the repair, rental and
servicing of any article the sale of which is a permitted use in this district.
   (z)   Assembling, finishing, cleaning or other processing of products which
is clearly incidental to a permitted retail or service business, where goods so
processed are to be sold exclusively on the premises, provided the total area
devoted to such activities does not exceed one-third (1/3) of the total gross
floor area devoted to the retail or service use.
   (aa)   Accessory buildings and uses, including seasonal outdoor storage
which are customarily incidental to a permitted principal use in accordance
with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (bb)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility or existing telecommunications tower in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (cc)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1151.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Commercial outdoor recreation facilities.
   (b)   Premises exclusively designed to provide drive through facilities.
   (c)   Park and ride lots.
   (d)   Class III telecommunications facilities. (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-
11.)
1151.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   No lot area regulations shall apply, however yard regulations shall be
as follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard as
follows:
 
STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  30 feet
70 to 74 feet      25 feet
75 to 79 feet      20 feet
80 feet or greater 15 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be twenty-five (25) feet.
   (b)   Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening shall be
provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along side and
rear lot lines.
   (c)   The maximum building height shall be three stories, not exceeding
thirty-five (35) feet in height.
   (d)   Corner lots shall be large enough to comply with the following
requirements:
      (1)   The minimum width of a corner lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the front street right-of-way line shall be sixty-five (65)
feet.
      (2)   The minimum side yard of the side facing the side street shall be
fifteen (15) feet wide.
1151.05 ARCHITECTURAL AND LANDSCAPING CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "B-2" District shall provide buildings
of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible with adjacent
uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. Landscaping and plantings
along or within a public right-of-way and within vehicular use areas shall be
provided as required in this Zoning Code in accordance with an approved
Landscaping Plan.
1151.06 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements set forth in Chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "B-2" Community
Commercial District.

1153.01  APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-2A" District is to accommodate intensive commercial
activities which generate high levels of vehicular traffic. This district is
designed for those commercial facilities which are strongly highway oriented
and which prefer maximum exposure to the traveling public, however it also
requires larger lot sizes and offers greater open space opportunities in order
to provide a more environmentally sound commercial area. This district should
apply to undeveloped tracts of land and to those lands annexed by the City
after the effective date of this chapter.

conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Commercial outdoor recreation facilities.
   (b)   Premises exclusively designed to provide drive through facilities.

1153.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   Minimum required for all uses:
   (a)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be forty thousand (40,000)
square feet.
   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance fifty (50) feet back
from the street right-of-way line shall be one hundred thirty (130) feet.
   (c)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be two hundred fifty (250)
feet.
   (d)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard as
follows:
 
STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  50 feet
70 to 74 feet      45 feet
75 to 79 feet      40 feet
80 feet or greater 35 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of twenty-five (25) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
   (e)   Screening. Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening
shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along
side and rear lot lines.
   (f)   Height. The maximum building height shall be three stories, not
exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
   (g)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
1153.05 ARCHITECTURAL AND LANDSCAPING CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "B-2A" District shall provide
buildings of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible
with adjacent uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. Landscaping and
plantings along or within a public right-of-way and within vehicular use areas
shall be provided as required in this Zoning Code in accordance with an

   The off-street parking requirements set forth in Chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "B-2A" Community
Commercial District.
CHAPTER 1155
"B-3" Regional Commercial District
1155.01   Application of district.

1185.40
 
 
1155.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-3" District is to accommodate a planned and organized
approach to providing an array of retail business and service opportunities of
a regional character in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185. These planned and organized shopping areas may be enclosed malls or open
shopping centers with common pedestrian or vehicular ways, walks, streets and
parking facilities, designed for commercial establishments serving the
residents of the City as well as persons from outside the community. These are
distinguished from the "strip" business stores found along the major highways
in the "B-2" and "B-2A" Community Commercial Districts.
1155.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "B-3" Regional Commercial District:
   (a)   Retail businesses, including antique shops; apparel shops; appliance
sales; art galleries; automobile supply stores; bakeries; bars or taverns;
beer, wine and liquor sales; book, magazine, and newspaper sales; candy or ice
cream sales; carpet and rug sales; candle and gift shops; china and glassware
sales; cybercafés; commercial indoor recreation facilities; department stores;
minor automobile repair, oil change facilities and automobile tire shops only
when conducted in conjunction with a department store; and drug stores; florist
or plant shops; furniture rental or sales; greeting card and stationary sales;
grocery stores and hypermarkets; hobby or craft shops; home improvement
centers; jewelry sales; medical equipment supply stores; motion picture
theaters; musical instrument sales; paint and wallpaper stores; pet shops and
pet supply stores; photo shops; snack bars/snack shops; tobacco products sales;
toy stores; restaurants; fast food restaurants with or without a drive through
facility; sporting goods stores; upholstery/interior design services; video
arcades; and other similar retail uses; including sidewalk sales and sidewalk
vendor stands, but excluding establishments exclusively designed to provide
through facilities.
   (b)   Business and professional services, including: accountant, architect,
attorney, engineer or surveyor offices; banks, credit unions, savings and loan
companies, and other financial services; massage and physical therapy
establishments; office supply and equipment sales; photocopying shops; medical
offices or clinics; mortgage, investment and real estate and insurance offices;
and other similar business and professional service uses; but excluding
establishments designed to provide through facilities.
   (c)   Personal services, including: barber shops and beauty salons; health/
sports clubs; nail salons and tanning studios; child day care centers; day
spas; photography studios and photo shops; dance or gymnastic studios; music
studios; dry cleaning and laundry pick up and services; photography studios and
photo shops; commercial wedding chapels; travel agencies; tuxedo rental; and
other similar personal service uses; but excluding establishments designed to
provide through facilities.
   (d)   Repair and rental services, including the repair, rental and servicing
of any article the sale of which is a permitted use in this district.
   (e)   Assembling, finishing, cleaning or other processing of products which
is clearly incidental to a permitted retail or service business, where goods so
processed are to be sold exclusively on the premises, provided the total area
devoted to such activities does not exceed one-third (1/3) of the total gross
floor area devoted to the retail or service use.
   (f)   Signs but not billboards in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (g)   Accessory buildings and uses, including seasonal outdoor storage which
are customarily incidental to a permitted principal use in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (h)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility or existing telecommunications tower in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (i)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1155.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Commercial outdoor recreation facilities.
   (b)   Garden apartments.
   (c)   Gas station mini-marts and gasoline service stations.
   (d)   Hotels, motels and conference centers.
   (e)   Premises exclusively designed to provide drive through facilities.
   (f)    Class III telecommunications facilities. (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-
11.)
1155.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   Minimum required for all uses within a mall or shopping center complex:
   (a)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be sixty thousand (60,000)
square feet.
   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance fifty (50) feet back
from the street right-of-way line shall be one hundred seventy-five (175) feet.
   (c)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be three hundred (300) feet.
   (d)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard as
follows:
 
STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  50 feet
70 to 74 feet      45 feet
75 to 79 feet      40 feet
80 feet or greater 35 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of thirty (30) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be thirty (30) feet.
   (e)   Screening. Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening
shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along
side and rear lot lines.
   (f)   Height. The maximum building height shall be seven stories, not
exceeding one hundred (100) feet in height.
1155.05 ARCHITECTURAL AND LANDSCAPING CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "B-3" District shall provide buildings
of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible with adjacent
uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. Landscaping and plantings
along or within a public right-of-way and within vehicular use areas shall be
provided as required in this Zoning Code in accordance with an approved
Landscaping Plan.
1155.06 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements set forth in Chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "B-3" Regional
Commercial District.

1157.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-4" District is to accommodate professional and
business office uses which are incompatible with and generate less traffic than
retail commercial activities. This district is designed for office uses which
are compatible with medium density residential areas and is meant to serve as a
transitional area between residential and intensive commercial districts.
1157.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "B-4" Professional and Business
Office District:
   (a)   All permitted residential uses as listed and regulated in the "R-2"
Medium Density Residential District; or where this district is applied to lands
annexed by the City after the effective date of this chapter, residential uses
shall be permitted as listed and regulated in the "R-2A" Medium Density
Residential District.
   (b)   Business and professional services, including: accountant, architect,
attorney, engineer or surveyor offices; banks, credit unions, savings and loan
companies, and other financial services; massage and physical therapy
establishments; medical offices or clinics; mortgage, investment and real
estate and insurance offices; and other similar business and professional
service uses; but excluding establishments designed to provide through
facilities.
   (c)   Art galleries or artist studios
   (d)   Business offices and administrative offices for charitable, fraternal,
governmental and social organizations; but excluding establishments designed to
provide through facilities.
   (e)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (f)   Signs but not billboards in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (g)   Accessory buildings and uses, including seasonal outdoor storage which
are customarily incidental to a permitted principal use in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (h)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1157.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Funeral homes and mortuaries.
   (b)   Drive-through banks.
   (c)    Nursing homes.
   (d)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1157.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
Minimum required for all uses:
   (a)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be seven thousand five hundred
(7,500) square feet.
   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of-way line shall be sixty (60) feet.
   (c)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100) feet.
   (d)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard
setback as follows:
 
STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  30 feet
70 to 74 feet      25 feet
75 to 79 feet      20 feet
80 feet or greater 15 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be twenty-five (25) feet.
   (e)   Screening. Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening
shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along
side and rear lot lines.
   (f)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half stories,
not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
   (g)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
1157.05 ARCHITECTURAL AND LANDSCAPING CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the "B-4" District shall provide buildings
of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible with adjacent
uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. Landscaping and plantings
along or within a public right-of-way and within vehicular use areas shall be
provided as required in this Zoning Code in accordance with an approved
Landscaping Plan.
1157.06  OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements set forth in chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "B-4" Professional and
Business Office District.

1159.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "B-5" District is to accommodate the daily shopping needs
of neighborhood residents. This district is designed for those small retail
businesses and services serving adjacent residential areas and dealing directly
with the public. Business establishments are restricted to a maximum floor area
of ten thousand (10,000) square feet each in order to limit the volume of
vehicular and pedestrian traffic. The distribution or sale of alcoholic
beverages is prohibited in this district. These businesses are distinguished
from the intensive commercial uses found in the Community and Regional
Commercial Districts.
1159.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the “B-5" Neighborhood Commercial
District:
   (a)   All permitted residential uses as listed and regulated in the “R-2"
Medium Density Residential District; or where this district is applied to lands
annexed by the City after the effective date of this chapter, residential uses
shall be permitted as listed and regulated in the “R-2A” Medium Density
Residential District.
   (b)   Retail businesses, including antique shops; apparel shops; art
galleries or artist studios; bakeries, book, magazine, and newspaper sales,
candy or ice cream sales; candle and gift shops; china and glassware sales;
convenience stores without drive through facilities; drug stores; florist or
plant shops; greeting card and stationary sales; grocery stores; hardware
stores; hobby or craft shops; jewelry sales; tobacco products; sales; toy
stores; restaurants without drive through facilities; sporting goods stores;
and other similar retail uses; but excluding amusement arcades, excluding
restaurants with stages, dance floors, outdoor seating or outdoor cooking, and
excluding used merchandise stores, pawnshops, and establishments designed to
provide drive through facilities.
   (c)   Business and professional services, including: accountant, architect,
attorney, engineer or surveyor offices, banks, credit unions, savings and loan
companies, and other financial services; massage and physical therapy
establishments; medical offices or clinics, mortgage, investment and real
estate and insurance offices; and other similar business and professional
service uses; but excluding bail bond agencies and establishments designed to
provide drive through facilities.
   (d)   Personal services, including: barber shops and beauty salons; nail
salons and tanning studios; child day care centers; laundromats; photography
studios and photo shops; dance or gymnastic studios; music studios; dry
cleaning and laundry pick up and services; photography studios and photo shops;
karate studios; and other similar personal service uses; but excluding tattoo
establishments and establishments designed to provide drive through facilities.
   (e)   Mixed use buildings containing the permitted uses as listed in this
section.
   (f)   Repair and rental services, including the repair, rental and servicing
of any article the sale of which is a permitted use in this district.
   (g)   Assembling, finishing, cleaning or other processing of products which
is clearly incidental to a permitted retail or service business, where goods so
processed are to be sold exclusively on the premises, provided the total area
devoted to such activities does not exceed one-third (1/3) of the total gross
floor area devoted to the retail or service use.
   (h)   Neighborhood shopping centers, in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (i)   Business offices and administrative offices for charitable, fraternal,
governmental and social organizations; but excluding establishments designed to
provide through facilities.
   (j)   Churches, convents and monasteries.
   (k)   Signs but not portable signs or billboards in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (l)   Accessory buildings and uses which are customarily incidental to a
permitted principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (m)   Utility service facilities to the extent necessary to serve
surrounding areas.
      (Ord. 2014-96. Passed 10-14-14.)
1159.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
    The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Drive-through banks.
   (b)   Nursing homes.
   (c)   Clubs, lodges, and community centers.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1159.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.

square feet.
   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the street right-of-way line shall be seventy-five (75) feet.
   (c)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be one hundred (100) feet.
   (d)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as
follows:
      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard
setback as follows:
 
STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  30 feet
70 to 74 feet      25 feet
75 to 79 feet      20 feet
80 feet or greater 15 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of ten (10) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be twenty-five (25) feet.
         (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
   (e)   Screening. Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening
shall be provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code
alongside and rear lot lines. All refuse disposal containers for uses other
than one or two-family residential must be concealed within a building, or
behind a solid fence or masonry wall.
(Ord. 2014-96. Passed 10-14-14.)
   (f)   Height. The maximum building height shall be two and one-half stories,
not exceeding thirty-five (35) feet in height.
   (g)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
erection of buildings, observing the minimum front yard setback from both
streets.
      (Ord. 1992-20. Passed 4-21-92.)
1159.05 ARCHITECTURAL AND LANDSCAPING CONTROLS.
   Any uses hereinafter permitted in the “B-5" District shall provide buildings
of a type and character which would be architecturally compatible with adjacent
uses in scale, proportion, design and materials. Sidewalks, landscaping and
plantings adjacent to buildings, along or within a public right-of-way, and
within vehicular use areas shall be considered an integral component of site
design and be provided as required in this Zoning Code in accordance with an
approved Landscaping Plan.
(Ord. 2014-96. Passed 10-14-14.)

   The off-street parking requirements set forth in Chapter
1185  of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "B-5" Neighborhood
Commercial District.

1161.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "I-1" District is to accommodate businesses which require
special criteria due to more intensive usage, heavy rail or truck traffic,
noise, glare of lights, or activities which because of special or unique
characteristics, are incompatible with residential or business uses in other
districts. This district should not generally apply to lands annexed by the
City after the effective date of this chapter.
1161.02 PERMITTED USES.
    The following uses are permitted in the "I-1" General Commercial and
Industrial District:
   (a)   All permitted uses as listed and regulated in the "B-2" Community
Commercial District, but not residential structures or dwelling units.
   (b)   Wholesale establishments.
   (c)   Appliance repair
   (d)   Construction trades.
   (e)   Laboratories.
   (f)   Veterinary clinics, animal shelters, animal grooming services and
kennels.
   (g)   Carpet or rug cleaning.
   (h)    Farm supply stores.
   (i)    Heavy machinery sales.
   (j)    Major automobile repair and automobile paint shops.
   (k)   Boat, motorcycle, recreational vehicle, snowmobile or all-purpose
vehicle repair.
   (l)   Commercial printing/publishing.
   (m)   Parcel delivery services.
   (n)   Self storage units.
   (o)   Portable storage unit sales or rental.
   (p)   Commercial vehicle sales and repair.
   (q)   Building material sales, but not stone crushing, concrete mixing or
asphalt plants.
   (r)   Industrial supply sales.
   (s)   Beverage bottling and distribution.
   (t)   Pest extermination businesses.
   (u)   Fire extinguisher and fire suppression system sales.
   (v)   Park and ride lots.
   (w)   Cemetery monument works with or without a retail outlet on the
premises.
   (x)   Utility transmission and distribution facilities; utility company
offices, garages and warehouses; and utility service facilities.
   (y)   A caretaker's residence.
   (z)   Signs, but not billboards, in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (aa)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility or existing telecommunications tower in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (bb)   Accessory buildings and uses which are customarily incidental to a
permitted principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1161.03 CONDITIONAL USES.
   The following uses are permitted subject to the satisfaction of certain
conditions which shall take into consideration the public health, safety and
welfare, and the comfort and convenience of the general public and residents of
the immediate neighborhood, as provided for in Chapter
1191 of this Zoning Code.
   (a)   Bus terminals.
   (b)   Truck or motor freight terminals.
   (c)   Warehouses and distribution centers.
   (d)   Sales of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) or home heating oil.
   (e)   Recyclable collection centers.
   (f)   Class III telecommunications facilities.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)
1161.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Except where provided for in Chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code, no area or yard regulations shall apply except for a
lot which abuts a residential district. In this case, there shall be a front
yard applicable to the business or industrial lot of ten (10) feet or one-half
the average front yard applicable to the nearest residence in the adjoining
residential district, whichever is greater. However, in no case need this front
yard be more than twenty (20) feet.
   (b)   Where a business use abuts a residential lot, screening shall be
provided by the property owner as defined in this Zoning Code along side and
rear lot lines.
   (c)   The maximum building height shall be five stories, not exceeding sixty
(60) feet in height.
   (d)   Corner lots shall be large enough to comply with the following
requirements:
      (1)   The minimum width of a corner lot at a distance twenty-five (25)
feet back from the front street right-of-way line shall be sixty-five (65)
feet.
      (2)   The minimum side yard on the side facing the side street shall be
fifteen (15) feet.
1161.05 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   The off-street parking requirements set forth in chapter
1185 of this Zoning Code shall be complied with in the "I-1" General Commercial
and Industrial District.

1165.01 APPLICATION OF DISTRICT.
   The purpose of the "I-2" District is to accommodate a planned and organized
approach to providing industrial and office opportunities. These planned and
organized areas may be unified industrial parks with common access roads and
facilities or areas along major highways designed for industrial and office
use. This district should apply to undeveloped tracts of land and to those
lands annexed by the City after the effective date of this chapter.
1165.02 PERMITTED USES.
   The following uses are permitted in the "I-2" Light Industrial District:
   (a)   Business and professional services, as listed in the "B-1" Central
Business District.
   (b)   Construction trades.
   (c)   Laboratories.
   (d)   Commercial printing/publishing.
   (e)   Parcel delivery services.
   (f)   Beverage bottling and distribution.
   (g)   Machine shops, excluding punch presses over twenty (20) tons capacity
and drop hammers.
   (h)   The manufacture, compounding, assembling or treatment of articles or
merchandise from the following previously prepared materials: cellophane,
canvas, cloth, cork, felt, film, glass, leather, paper or cardboard, plastics,
steel, tin or aluminum, precious or semi-precious metals or stones, textiles,
tobacco, wood and yarns.
   (i)   The manufacture, processing or packaging of dairy and food products,
excluding slaughter houses and the rendering of hides and bones.
   (j)   The manufacturing of pottery and figurines, or other similar glass or
ceramic products, using kilns fired only by electricity or natural gas.
   (k)   The manufacture, compounding, processing or packaging of cosmetics,
pharmaceuticals and toiletries.
   (l)   The manufacture of musical instruments, bicycles, toys, novelties,
rubber or metal stamps, and any other small molded rubber products.
   (m)   The manufacture and assembly of electrical appliances and electronic
instruments or devices.
   (n)   Light metal fabrication and assembly, and processing which shall
include finishing, grinding, sharpening, polishing, cleaning, rust-proofing and
painting.
   (o)   Wholesale and retail sales of products manufactured, produced or
distributed pursuant to a permitted principal use in whole or in part on the
lot in question.
   (p)   Utility transmission and distribution facilities; utility company
offices, garages and warehouses; and utility service facilities to the extent
necessary to serve surrounding areas.
   (q)   Signs, but not billboards, in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter
1185.
   (r)   Class II telecommunications facilities if co-locating on an existing
public facility or existing telecommunications tower in accordance with the
provisions of Chapter
1185.
   (s)   Accessory buildings and uses which are customarily incidental to a
permitted principal use in accordance with the provisions of Chapter
1185.
      (Ord. 2011-70. Passed 10-11-11.)

   (b)   Warehouses and distribution centers.

1165.04 AREA, FRONTAGE, HEIGHT AND YARD REGULATIONS.

   (a)   Area. The minimum area of any lot shall be eighty thousand (80,000)

   (b)   Width. The minimum width of any lot at a distance sixty (60) feet back
from the street right-of-way line shall be two hundred (200) feet.
   (c)   Depth. The minimum depth of any lot shall be three hundred fifty (350)

   (d)   Yards. The minimum front, side and rear yard dimensions shall be as

      (1)   Front Yard. Each main building shall have a minimum front yard as

STREET             MINIMUM FRONT
RIGHT-OF-WAY WIDTH YARD SETBACK
Less than 70 feet  50 feet
70 to 74 feet      45 feet
75 to 79 feet      40 feet
80 feet or greater 35 feet
      (2)   Side Yards. Two side yards shall be provided, each equal to a
minimum of fifty (50) feet.
      (3)   Rear Yard. The minimum rear yard shall be fifty (50) feet.
   (e)   Height. The maximum building height shall be five stories, not
exceeding sixty (60) feet in height, provided however that radio, television
and cellular telephone transmission or receiving facilities shall be exempt.
   (f)   Corner Lots. Corner lots shall be large enough to allow for the
