1321.01 PERSONNEL.
   (a)   The office of Building Inspector is hereby created.
   (b)   The office of Deputy Inspector is hereby created.
(Ord. 8892. Passed 11-6-57.)
   (c)    In the event of special need, additional temporary Inspectors with
special qualifications may be employed by the Building Inspector at the
prevailing rate for qualified craftsmen. Such Inspectors shall not be in the
classified service.
(Ord. 8892. Passed 11-6-57.)
1321.02 QUALIFICATIONS OF BUILDING INSPECTOR.
   The Building Inspector shall hold Certification as a Building Official,
Building Inspector, Residential Building Official, Residential Plans Examiner,
and Residential Building Inspector issued by the Ohio Board of Building
Standards or obtain the certifications within such time as required by the City
for the City to retain its certification to enforce the Ohio Building Code
(OBC) and the Residential Code of Ohio (RCO). He or she shall be in good health
and physically capable of making the necessary examinations and inspections of
buildings in the course of construction. He or she shall not have any interest
whatsoever, directly or indirectly, in the sale or manufacture of any material,
process or device entering into, or used in, or in connection with, building
construction.
(Ord. 2011-69. Passed 9-13-11.)
1321.03 QUALIFICATIONS OF DEPUTY BUILDING INSPECTOR.
   The Deputy Building Inspector shall hold Certification as a Residential
Building Inspector issued by the Ohio Board of Building Standards or obtain the
certification within one (1) year of employment. He or she shall be in good
health and physically capable of making the necessary examinations and
inspections of buildings in the course of construction. He or she shall not
have any interest whatsoever directly or indirectly in the sale or manufacture
of any new material, process or device entering into, or used in, or in
connection with, building construction. (Ord. 2011-69. Passed 9-13-11.)
1321.04 DUTIES OF BUILDING INSPECTOR.
   (a)    The Building Inspector shall receive applications required by this
Building Code, issue permits and furnish the prescribed certificates. When
permits are issued, immediate written notice is to be given to the inspectors
of other departments and divisions. He shall examine premises for which permits
have been issued and shall make necessary inspections to see that the
provisions of law are complied with and that the construction is prosecuted
safely. He shall enforce all laws relating to the construction, alteration,
repair, removal, demolition, equipment, use and occupancy, location and
maintenance of buildings and structures, except as may be otherwise provided
for. He shall, when requested by the City Manager, or when the interests of the
Municipality so require, make investigation in connection with matters referred
to in this Building Code and render written reports on the same. For the
purpose of enforcing compliance with the law, to remove illegal or unsafe
conditions, to secure the necessary safeguards during construction, or to
require adequate exit facilities in existing buildings and structures, he shall
issue such notices or orders as may be necessary.
   (b)    In addition to the foregoing duties, the Building Inspector when
reviewing applications for building permits including the plans and
specifications for proposed construction, will review all building permit
applications to determine if the proposed construction is consistent with the
need to minimize flood damage as well as to determine if the site of proposed
construction is reasonably safe from flooding and making recommendations for
construction in all locations having flood hazards.
   (c)    In reviewing all applications for construction in flood hazard
locations the Building Inspector shall require that any proposed construction
must:
      (1)    Be designed and anchored to prevent the flotation, collapse or
lateral movement of the structure or portions of the structure due to flooding.
      (2)    Use of construction materials and utility equipment that are
resistant to flood damage.
      (3)    Use of construction methods and practices that will minimize flood
damage.
      (4)    Provide adequate drainage in order to reduce exposure to flood
hazards.
      (5)    Locate public utilities and facilities on the site in such a
manner as to be elevated and constructed to minimize or eliminate flood damage,
such utilities and facilities including sewer, gas, electrical and water
systems. (Ord. 1975-88. Passed 4-29-75.)
1321.05 INSPECTIONS.
   The Building Inspector shall cause to be inspected at the time of the final
inspection of any construction, all electrical, gas and coal-powered appliances
of every nature that are installed within the structure, paying particular heed
to proper installation in accordance with manufacturers' instructions and the
safety provisions of this Building Code and other ordinances of the City. No
final certificate of approval shall be given until all such appliances are in
proper and safe working condition. (Ord. 8892. Passed 11-6-57.)
1321.06 RECORDS.
   The Building Inspector shall retain on file copies of required plans of
residence buildings for a period of one year following completion of
construction and on all other buildings for a period of two years following
completion of construction. After the one or two-year period herein required
for the retention of plans following completion of construction, the Building
Inspector may destroy such plans and make note on the building application
records that such has been done. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1321.07 REPORTS.
   The Building Inspector shall make written reports to the City Manager once
each month, or oftener if requested, including statements of permits and
certificates of occupancy issued, orders promulgated and receipts from building
permits.
(Ord. 1970-186. Passed 11-10-70.)
1321.08 COOPERATION OF OTHER OFFICIALS.
   The Building Inspector may request and shall receive as far as may be
necessary, in the discharge of his duties, the assistance and cooperation of
other officials of the Municipality. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1321.09 RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   The Building Inspector or any of his designated agents may at any reasonable
hour, enter any dwelling, multifamily dwelling, building, structure or premises
within the City to perform any duty imposed on him by this Building Code,
provided that permission to enter is obtained from the occupant or, in the case
of unoccupied property, from the owner or his agent. If such permission is
refused or is otherwise unobtainable, a search warrant must be obtained before
such entry or inspection is made, except in the case of an existing emergency
in which case entry may be made at any time and no search warrant is necessary.
No person shall refuse to permit such emergency entry or inspection, nor shall
any person hinder, obstruct, resist or abuse any person making or attempting to
make such entry or inspection.
1321.10 BUILDING INSPECTOR TO ISSUE CITATIONS.
   (a)    The Building Inspector is hereby given the power and authority to
issue citations for violations of all building and housing codes within the
City.
 
   (b)    The Building Inspector's designates are hereby given the power and
authority to issue on-site citations for violations of the following sections
of the Codified Ordinances:
1323.01,
1327.01,
1327.02 and
1327.03. (Ord. 1986-169. Passed 8-9-86.)
1321.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1335.99 general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)

1323.01 GENERAL REQUIREMENTS; LICENSING.
      (a)    Definitions.
            (1)    "Contractor" means any person, firm or corporation
contracting to supply materials or perform work or labor for another person,
firm or corporation for a stipulated sum.
            (2)    "Subcontractor" means any person, firm or corporation
assuming by secondary contract some or all of the obligations of an original
contractor.
             (3)    "City" means the City of Steubenville, Ohio.
            (4)    "Building Inspector" means the Building Inspector and Deputy
Inspectors of the City.
            (5)    "Building Official" means the person responsible for the
overall administration of a building division and enforcement of the Ohio
Building Code (OBC).
            (6)    "Qualification certificate" means a certificate issued by
the Ohio construction industry examining board to an individual or business
entity as a heating, ventilating, and air conditioning contractor,
refrigeration contractor, electrical contractor, plumbing contractor, or
hydronics contractor.
           (7)    "Heating, ventilating and air conditioning contractor" means
any individual who assumes responsible charge, supervision, or direction of
persons engaged in heating, ventilating and air conditioning contracting, or
who engages in, offers to engage in, advertises or otherwise represents that he
is permitted to engage in the design of, planning of, superintendent of,
contracting for, or responsible charge of heating, ventilating and air
conditioning contracting.
            (8)    "Refrigeration contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision or direction of persons engaged in
refrigeration contracting, or who engages in, offers to engage in, advertises
or otherwise represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage in the
design of, planning of, superintending of, contracting for, or responsible
charge of refrigeration contracting.
            (9)    "Electrical contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision, or direction of persons engaged in electrical
contracting, or who engages in, offers to engage in, advertises or otherwise
represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage in the design of,
planning of, superintending of, contracting for or responsible charge of
electrical contracting. As used in this division, "electrical contracting" does
not include the construction, installation, alteration, repair, maintenance or
service of any fire alarm or burglar alarm.
            (10)    "Plumbing contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision, or direction of persons engaged in plumbing
contracting, or who engages in, offers to engage in, advertises, or otherwise
represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage in the design of,
planning of, superintending of, contracting for, or responsible charge of
plumbing.
            (11)    "Hydronics contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision or direction of persons engaged in hydronics
contracting, or who engages in, offers to engage in, advertises, or otherwise
represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage in the design of,
planning of, superintending of, contracting for, or responsible charge of
hydronics contracting.
            (12)    "Tree trimming contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision, or direction of persons engaged in the
trimming, cutting, pruning, maintenance, protection or removal of trees, or who
engages in, offers to engage in, advertises, or otherwise represents that he is
permitted or qualified to engage in the design of, planning of, superintending
of, contracting for, or responsible charge of tree trimming, cutting, pruning
or removal.
           (13)    "Landscaping contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision, or direction of persons engaged in changing
the physical appearance of the land, or who engages in, offers to engage in,
advertises, or otherwise represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage
in the design of, planning of, superintending of, contracting for, or
responsible charge of changing the physical appearance of the land.
             (14)    "Painting contractor" means any individual who assumes
responsible charge, supervision, or direction of persons engaged in applying or
coating surfaces with paint, including cleaning, scraping or otherwise
preparing surfaces for paint, or who engages in, offers to engage in,
advertises, or otherwise represents that he is permitted or qualified to engage
in the design of, planning of, superintending of, contracting for, or
responsible charge of painting.
            (15)    "Contracting" means the engagement of a person under any
written or verbal contract, agreement, or understanding, whereby such person
provides services or materials which are subject to examination.
    
   (b)    License Requirements. No person, firm or corporation either as a
contractor or subcontractor shall perform any services without first obtaining
a license from the Building Inspector to perform such work within the City:
 
 
Fees                                                 Annual
A License: Commercial including B and C              $100.00
B License: Residential and Commercial up to $100,000 75.00
C License: Residential                               50.00
 
   (c)    Requirements for Mechanical License. Heating, ventilating and air
conditioning contractors, electrical contractors and hydronics contractors must
possess a valid qualification certification, issued by the Ohio Construction
Industry Examining Board, per Ohio Revised Code and HB 402 requirements. Such
certification will be required after July 1, 1995. In addition thereof, all
must have the following requirements:
            (1)    A certification from the Income Tax Division that such
person, firm or corporation is registered with such department, and if a
partnership, firm or corporation that all partners, employees, agents or
servants of such partnership, firm or corporation performing work or labor
within the City are registered therein.
             (2)    Proof of compliance with the Workers' Compensation laws of
the State.
            (3)    Proof of liability insurance either in the State of Ohio or
if a nonresident person, firm or corporation compliance within the home state.
Insurance must be in a minimum amount of one hundred thousand dollars
($100,000) per occurrence.
   
   (d)    Grandfathering for Mechanical License.  Grandfathering: Heating,
ventilating and air conditioning contractors, electrical contractors, hydronic
contractors and refrigeration contractors may request City grandfathering if
they meet the following requirements:
           (1)    Must have been a license contractor prior to license years
July 1992-1993.
            (2)    Must have been an active contractor in their licensed field
in the City. Proof of permits, inspections and jobs required.
            (3)    Professional questionnaire provided for the above years will
be used for appropriate fields of qualifications.
            (4)    Grandfathering will be for individual, not company and
cannot be transferred to another individual.
             (5)    Grandfathering will be given to the person meeting the
requirements as defined under
1323.01 (a). Request for grandfathering must be in writing, addressed to the
Building Division with documentation of above requirements. Deadline for
grandfathering will be April 1, 1995. No grandfathering will be considered
after that date.
   
   (e)    Requirements for General Construction License. General construction
contractors, tree trimming contractors, landscaping contractors and painting
contractors must meet the following requirements:
            (1)    A certification from the Income Tax Division that such
person, firm or corporation is registered with such department, and if a
partnership, firm or corporation that all partners, employees, agents or
servants of such partnership, firm or corporation performing work or labor
within the City are registered therein.
            (2)    Proof of compliance with Workers' Compensation laws of the
State.
            (3)    Proof of liability insurance either in the State of Ohio or
if a nonresident person, firm or corporation compliance within the home state.
Insurance must be in a minimum amount of one hundred thousand dollars
($100,000) per occurrence.
   
   (f)    Requirements for General Plumbing.
      (1)    No person, other than a master plumber holding a current license
issued by the State of Ohio, shall engage in the business of plumbing or expose
the sign of plumbing or any advertisement pertaining thereto.
            (2)    Any firm or corporation desiring to engage in the business
of plumbing, shall have at least an owner or officer of such firm or
corporation in possession of a current State of Ohio Master Plumber's License
who shall register with the Building Inspection Division, along with the name
or names of all officers of the firm or corporation for which he is
registering.
            (3)    No person, other than a person holding a current master
plumber's license issued by the State of Ohio and registered with the Building
Inspection Division, a licensed journeyman or registered apprentice plumber in
the employ of an Ohio licensed master plumber, shall install, alter or make
connections with any sewer, water, drain or any other pipe connected therewith;
or alter the location of any existing plumbing fixture(s), water distribution
piping system or sewer drainage system.
Exception:
A permit must be obtained and work may be done in an existing single family
dwelling as set forth in Chapter
1327 .
           (4)    No licensed master plumber shall do work in the City unless a
valid current permit to do so has been issued by the Building Inspection
Division.
            (5)    No licensed master plumber shall employ any person to do
plumbing who is not licensed as a journeyman plumber or registered as an
apprentice plumber; and no licensed journeyman plumber or registered apprentice
plumber shall perform any plumbing work except as supervised by a licensed
master plumber. The ratio of apprentice plumbers to journeymen shall be one
apprentice plumber for every two journeymen.
Exception:
One apprentice shall be allowed to work under the direct supervision of a
master plumber.
            (6)    Every licensed master plumber registered with the City shall
give immediate notice to the City of any change to his place of business or
upon termination of his business.
            (7)    No person, firm or corporation carrying on the business of
plumbing shall allow the owner's name to be used by any person, directly or
indirectly, by transfer, sale or otherwise, either to obtain a permit(s) or to
do any work under the owner's license.
   
   (g)    Registration Procedures.
      (1)    Any person seeking to register as a master plumber, journeyman
plumber or apprentice plumber, shall make application on a form prescribed and
approved by the Building Inspection Division, and shall, with such application,
identify the applicant and any company or business with whom the applicant will
be doing plumbing work. The application shall be completed and returned to the
office of the Plumbing Inspector where the same shall be kept on file.
Initially, such application shall be accompanied by the fee set forth
hereinafter.
            (2)    Every person desiring to conduct or engage in the plumbing
business in the City as a master plumber must present a copy of his current
master plumber license issued by the State of Ohio in order to register.
                  A.    The applicant for Master Plumber shall pay a
registration fee as set by the City and such registration may be renewed each
year by paying the renewal fee as set by the City. The registration year shall
commence on the first Monday of July of each year.
                  B.    The applicant for Master Plumber, shall furnish proof
that he possess a valid, current master plumber certification issued by the
State of Ohio; he or his company has properly registered with the Ohio Bureau
of Workers' Compensation and the Ohio Bureau of Employment. Such applicant
shall also furnish proof of liability insurance, including a rider for
underground insurance by providing an insurance certificate in the amount of
one million dollars ($1,000,000) and a surety bond with a surety company to be
approved by the City Manager, Plumbing Inspector and Law Director in the amount
of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) and, upon the condition that the applicant
shall indemnify, defend and save the City harmless from all damages that may
arise from the negligence of such applicant.
                  C.    Such applicant for master plumber shall furnish proof
that the applicant has an income tax account with the City.
            (3)    Each journeyman plumber shall register with the City and pay
an annual fee as set by the City. Journeyman plumbers shall be permitted to
install plumbing only under the supervision of a licensed master plumber.
            (4)    Each applicant for apprentice plumber shall not be required
to take an examination however, each apprentice plumber shall register with the
City and shall pay a yearly fee as set by the City. Each registered apprentice
plumber shall be permitted to serve his apprenticeship only under a registered
master plumber.
      (5)    All persons having a valid and unexpired qualification certificate
as issued by the State of Ohio to contract plumbing work shall be considered
master plumbers and all such persons shall register with the City and pay all
applicable fees.
            (6)    Such Master Plumber license, upon recommendation of the
Plumbing Inspector, may be revoked for improper installation or refusal or
failure to comply with the Building Inspection Division and this chapter and
may have his name reinstated on the register by the Building Inspection
Division after demonstrating his intention and ability to comply with
regulations and standards of this chapter and the current Ohio Plumbing Code.
   (h)    Requirements for Sewer Tappers and Water Service Line Installers.
      (1)    Each applicant for Sewer Tapper and Water service line Installer,
who has completed the examination to the satisfaction of the Plumbing
Inspector, shall obtain a registration certificate, upon payment of a
registration fee as set by the City, prior to the first Monday of the month of
July, upon compliance with the following conditions:
               A.    The applicant for Sewer Tapper and Water Service-line
Installer shall furnish documentation that he or his company has properly
registered with the Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation and the Ohio Bureau of
Employment. Such applicant shall also provide proof of liability insurance with
a rider for underground insurance by issuance of a certificate of insurance in
the amount of one million dollars ($1,000,000) and a surety bond with a surety
company to be approved by the City Manager, Plumbing Inspector and the Law
Director in the amount of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) and upon the condition
that the applicant shall indemnify defend and save the City harmless from all
damages that may arise from the negligence of such applicant.
               B.    Such applicant for Sewer Tapper and Water service line
Installer shall furnish proof that the applicant has an income tax account with
the City.
               C.    No licensed Sewer Tapper and Water service line Installer
shall be permitted to extend or lay any sewer closer than three (3) feet from
any building. All sewer work located within three (3) feet of a building shall
be completed by a master plumber.
   
   (i)    Registration Period. Registration shall be valid for one (1) calendar
year (from January 1 to December 31) unless false information was furnished on
the registration form. Renewal of registration including submission of
completed registration forms and payment of applicable fees shall be required
by no later than January 30th of each year. Fees for new registration shall not
be prorated if registration is required for less than one (1) calendar year;
however fees for renewal of registration may be prorated if for less than one
(1) calendar year. All fees collected shall be deposited with the Director of
Finance.
   
   (j)    Noncompliance. That failure of any person, firm or corporation to
meet any of the foregoing requirements, shall cause the Building Inspector to
refuse to issue a permit for the performance of any work by such contractor or
subcontractor within the City.
(Ord. 2017-91. Passed 12-5-17.)
1323.02 REFRIGERATION PERMIT.
   No person shall commence or proceed with the installation, alteration,
replacement or addition to any mechanical refrigeration system or part thereof
in any building in the City until application has been made for a mechanical
refrigeration permit, nor until such plans, specifications and other
information as may be required by the Building Inspector for the proper
enforcement of the provisions of this Building Code pertaining to mechanical
refrigeration have been filed with the Building Inspector and the mechanical
refrigeration permit applied for has been issued by him
   A permit shall be required for every new installation or alteration of a
refrigerating system containing a Group 2 or Group 3 refrigerant, as such
classifications are described in an American National Standards Institute
publication, designated ASA B 9.1-1964.
   A permit shall be required for every new installation or alteration of a
refrigerating system containing more than sixty pounds of a Group 1
refrigerant.
   No permit for a refrigerating system containing a Group 3 refrigerant shall
be issued and no such system shall be installed except after approval by the
Building Inspector given upon submission of acceptable evidence that no public
hazard will be created thereby. A refrigerating system containing Group 3
refrigerant shall be installed in conformity with the conditions of approval
specified by the Building Inspector.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.03 APPLICATION.
   An application for a permit shall be submitted in such form as the Building
Division may prescribe.
   Such application shall be made by the owner or lessee, or agent of either,
including the architect, engineer or builder employed in connection with the
proposed work. If such application is made by a person other than the owner in
fee, it shall be accompanied by duly verified affidavit of the owner in fee or
the person making the application, stating that the proposed work is authorized
by the owner in fee and that the person making the application is authorized to
make such application.
   Such application shall contain the full names and addresses of the applicant
and of the owner, and if the owner is a corporate body, of its responsible
officer.
   Such application shall describe briefly the proposed work and shall give
such additional information as may be required by the Building Division for an
intelligent understanding of the proposed work.
   No person, firm or corporation shall construct, alter, remove or demolish or
commence the construction, alteration, removal or demolition of any building or
structure, or install any equipment for the operation of a building or
structure without first filing with the Building Inspector, an application in
writing and obtaining a formal permit in conformity with Sections
1323.10 through
1323.17.
(Ord. 1994-123. Passed 1-10-95.)
 
1323.04 PLANS.
   Applications for permits shall be accompanied by drawings of the proposed
work, drawn to scale, showing, when necessary, floor plans, sections,
elevations and structural details, as the Building Inspector may require. (Ord.
8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.05 PLOT PLAN.
   When required by the Building Inspector, there shall be submitted a plot
plan in a form and size designated by the Building Inspector for filing
permanently with the permit record, drawn to scale, with all dimensions
figured, showing accurately the size and exact locations of all proposed new
construction and the relation to other existing or proposed structures on the
same lot and other structures on adjoining property within ten feet of the
property lines, or, in the case of demolition, of such construction as is to be
demolished, and of all existing buildings and structures that are to remain.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.06 AMENDMENTS.
   Nothing in this chapter shall prohibit the filing of amendments to an
application or to a plan or other record accompanying the same, at any time
before the completion of the work for which the permit was issued. Such
amendments shall be filed with and be deemed a part of the original
application, if approved before the certificate of occupancy has been issued;
otherwise a new application for the alteration shall be made and a permit
secured.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.07 EXCEPTED WORK.
   No building permit fee shall be charged for general alterations with a value
of less than five thousand dollars ($5,000.00), painting or cleaning of
buildings or structures. The erection of signs, billboards and similar
structures shall require a permit regardless of the cost or value. No building
permit will be issued for any sign, billboard or similar structure for any
zoning district in which they are not permitted. No permit shall be required
for repair of a refrigerating system.
   No building permit shall be required for general alterations with a value of
one thousand dollars ($1,000) or less. No permit fee shall be charged for
general alterations with a value of more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) but
less than five thousand dollars ($5000.00), however all persons completing
general alterations with a value of more than one thousand dollars ($1,000)
must still submit an Application for Building Permit pursuant to Section
1323.03 and shall be subject to the application fee thereof pursuant to Section
1327.01.
(Ord. 2022-100. Passed 1-3-23.)
1323.08 CONFORMITY REQUIRED WITH OR WITHOUT PERMIT.
   Where a permit is not required by this Building Code, such exemption shall
apply only to the requirements for a permit; all installation, alterations or
repairs, whether made with or without a permit, shall be made in conformity
with this Code. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.09 ACTION ON APPLICATION.
   The Building Inspector shall examine or cause to be examined applications
for permits within a reasonable time after filing. If, after examination, he
finds no objection to the same and it appears that the proposed work will be in
compliance with the Planning and Zoning, Building and Fire Prevention Codes and
other ordinances in effect applicable thereto and the proposed construction or
work will be safe, he shall approve such application and issue a permit for the
proposed work as soon as practicable. If his examination reveals otherwise, he
shall reject such application, noting his findings in a written report to be
attached to the application and delivering a copy to the applicant. (Ord. 8611.
Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.10 APPROVAL BY OTHER DIVISIONS.
   The Engineering and Building Inspection Division may call upon the
Steubenville Planning and Zoning Commission, the Fire Division, the Board of
Health or any other City department or division for approval of submitted plans
or applications as they affect the specific administrative area of those
departments or divisions. All applications in Fire District No. 1 shall be
approved by the Fire Division. All applications for which septic tanks are
included shall be approved by the Board of Health. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.11 APPROVAL IN PART.
   Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to prevent the Building Inspector
from issuing a permit for the construction of a part of a building or structure
before the entire plans and detailed statements of such building or structure
have been submitted or approved, provided adequate information and detailed
statements have been submitted for the same and have been found to comply with
this Building Code. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.12 PERMIT FOR DEMOLITION/REMOVAL.
   No person, firm or corporation, whether acting as owner, contractor or
subcontractor shall commence to raze, demolish or tear down any building or
part thereof consisting of more than two hundred (200) square feet, nor shall
any person, firm or corporation raze or demolish any building by fire of any
dimension whatsoever without first obtaining a permit from the City. Such
permits are to be issued by the Building Inspector upon application by the
owner and/or person, firm or corporation in charge of razing such building.
Before a permit will be issued to any person, firm or corporation for the
razing or demolishing of any building or part thereof, the application for the
permit shall be accompanied by proof of liability insurance of not less than
one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) to three hundred thousand dollars
($300,000) coverage for persona/liability, and one hundred thousand dollars
($100,000) for property liability, as well as proof of compliance with the Ohio
Workers' Compensation Laws, should the same be applicable. The insurance
coverage provided for herein shall be with a company or companies licensed to
do business in the State. All requirements for contractor licensing and
permitting contained in this Chapter and Chapter
1327 shall apply.
(Ord. 2012-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1323.121 BOND REQUIREMENTS.
   Every person. firm or corporation as set forth in Section
1323.12 hereof shall post a bond with the City and to the benefit of the City
in the sum of five thousand dollars ($5,000) conditioned upon the faithful
performance of work under the terms and provisions of this Chapter. The
acceptable types of bond are as follows:
   (a)    Certified check payable to the City: or
   (b)    Performance bond of form satisfactory to the Law Director.
      (Ord. 2012-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1323.122 ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR RAZING OR DEMOLITION.
      Any building which is razed or demolished in accordance with the terms
and provisions of this chapter shall be done so subject to the following
conditions:
   (a)    General.     
      (1)   All demolition debris and all trash, rubbish, or other debris,
including all tires and concrete/masonry materials must be removed from the
site and properly disposed of at a licensed landfill in accordance with Federal
and State laws.
      (2)   No trash, rubbish, debris, lumber, glass or other materials from a
razed or demolished building shall be permitted to remain upon the lot or tract
of land upon which such building was located longer than five (5) days after
the razing or demolishing of such building.
      (3)   Salvage material shall not be permitted to be stored upon any
property whether privately owned or owned by the City unless such storage is
authorized by the Building Inspector and also approved by the City Manager.
      (4)   All walks, steps, walls, driveways, slabs and other appurtenances
shall be removed from the site unless such removal creates a hazard to adjacent
structures as determined by the Building Inspector.
           (5)    No material shall be stored upon a site so as to constitute a
hazard or an unsightly condition, unless such material is to be used for
construction of another structure to be constructed within thirty (30) days
from the date of the storing of such materials.
      (6)   No advertising of any description, bill posting or the erection of
signs of any type shall be permitted upon any barricades erected in the
demolition area other than for the purpose of warning the general public or
providing directions to traverse the demolition area.
      (7)   Demolition shall only be permitted to take place Monday through
Friday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. (except holidays) unless an
alternative schedule is approved in advance by the Building Inspector.
      (8)   All streets, alleys, sidewalks and utilities adjacent to the site
shall be protected from damage during demolition. In the event of damage caused
by demolition activities, the owner and/or contractor shall be responsible for
the cost of repairs.
      (9)   In the event of conflict between these requirements and the
provisions of any Federal, State or local law, the more restrictive provision
shall govern.
   (b)    Safety.
            (1)    Working conditions and equipment for those persons involved
in the demolition of buildings shall be in accordance with all Federal and
State laws governing and regulating the demolition of buildings.
      (2)    Areas upon which demolition of buildings is taking place shall be
cleaned of debris daily so as to prevent the accumulation of hazardous and
unhealthful conditions.
      (3)   Pedestrians shall be protected during demolition activities. Signs
shall be provided to direct pedestrian traffic. Pedestrian protection measures
shall be approved by the Building Inspector prior to the granting of a permit.
      (4)   Walks with guardrails shall be provided for the safety and use of
the public required to traverse the area adjacent to the demolition site unless
the Building Inspector authorizes the sidewalk to be closed. Walks shall be of
sufficient width to accommodate pedestrian traffic, but in no case shall they
be less than four (4) feet in width. Walkways shall be provided with a durable,
all-weather walking surface. Walkways shall be designed to support all imposed
loads.
      (5)   Pedestrian traffic shall be protected by a directional barricade
where the walkway extends into the street. The directional barricade shall be
of sufficient size and construction to direct vehicular traffic away from the
pedestrian path.
      (6)   Sufficient barricades and warning lights shall be erected so as to
effectively warn the public of the existing danger of the demolition of the
buildings. Such barricades shall be erected with sufficient height and distance
so as to insure that debris from the demolition of the building shall not spill
upon private property adjoining the demolition site, or upon public streets and
walkways.
      (7)   Pedestrian protection required by this section shall maintained in
place and kept in good condition for the entire length of time pedestrians may
be endangered. The owner or contractor, upon completion of site restoration,
shall immediately remove walkways and other obstructions and leave the site in
the condition which existed prior to demolition.
    (c)    Utilities.
       (1)   Electrical, natural gas, telephone and cable television service
shall be disconnected prior to the start of demolition. Protection shall be
provided for all utilities that are required to remain in use while the
demolition takes place.
      (2)   Water service shall be terminated by the City at the curb box. In
the event there is no functioning curb box or water service cannot be shut off,
termination shall be coordinated with the City Water Department.
      (3)   Any sanitary sewers within any buildings to be demolished must be
plugged at the outlet with concrete and approved by the Building Inspector
prior to backfilling.
   (d)    Dust Control.   
      (1)   Areas upon which demolition is occurring shall be kept as dust free
as possible, and covered shoots and roll-off containers/vehicles shall be used
in disposing and hauling away of debris.
      (2)   Buildings being razed or demolished shall be watered down
throughout, before and during demolition, so as to insure and protect against
fire and dust or other air-borne particles being spread to adjoining
properties.
      (3)   Fire hydrants required to be used during the demolition or utilized
in pre-cleaning or post- cleaning of the area shall be used only when in
compliance with the City of Steubenville Water Policy. A copy of the Water
Policy is on file with and available from the Utility Collection Office. A
water truck may be used to supply water for dust control in lieu of connection
to a fire hydrant.
      (e)    Basement Floors. Any building with concrete basement floors shall
have such floors broken up, so as to provide for adequate drainage during the
time of razing or demolition.
   (f)   Backfilling.   
      (1)   Foundations, crawl spaces, tanks, basements, wells, cisterns and
other voids must be removed to at least twenty-four (24) inches below grade
level and backfilled to prior grade.
      (2)   Backfill material shall consist of uncontaminated clean hard fill
as defined by the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency and Ohio Administrative
Code section 3745-400-05 and shall not include plastic or rubber, metal, glass,
cloth, brush, trees, wood, or any combustible material. If the fill contains
concrete/masonry/stone materials, such materials must not exceed six (6) inches
in any dimension and shall be placed in lifts no thicker than eighteen (18)
inches as placed and compacted with suitable non-vibrating compaction equipment
(Sheep's Foot Compactor). Lift thickness must be reduced to eight (8) inches in
confined areas accessible only to hand guided compaction equipment (Walk Behind
Sheep's Foot Compactor).
      (3)   Any material generated from the demolition site, including
concrete/masonry material, shall be considered demolition debris and shall be
disposed of properly. Such material cannot be used as backfill material.
   (g)    Site Restoration.
      (1)   Upon completion of backfilling, at least four (4) inches of soil
which will support grass vegetation shall be placed over the entire disturbed
area, the area seeded with common lawn grass and then mulched.
      (2)   Prior to seeding and mulching, the final demolition site shall be
hand-raked so as to leave a surface free of rock or other debris that is not
compacted and is capable of receiving and supporting grass seed/growth. The
grade shall consist of the grade that existed prior to demolition so that
surface drainage to or from abutting properties is not adversely affected,
unless another grade is approved by the Building Inspector.
      (3)   Compliance with the site restoration requirements in this
subsection shall not be required where another structure is to be constructed
on the site, when such construction will begin within thirty (30) days, and
when a building permit has been issued for such construction.
   (h)    Warranty.
        (1)   The owner and/or contractor shall guarantee the work against
improper settlement for a period of one (1) year from the date of completion of
work.
      (2)   In the event of improper settling which causes gullying, holes,
dips or other voids during the warranty period, the owner and/or contractor
must return to the site to fill, properly compact, grade, seed and mulch the
site as per the requirements of this Section. The failure to properly correct
problems caused by improper settling within the time period specified by the
Building Inspector shall be considered a violation of this Section.
(Ord. 2017-11. Passed 2-21-17.)
1323.123 PERMIT FEE; VALIDITY.
   (a)    The permit fee provided herein shall be in an amount specified in
Section
1327.03.
   (b)    Any permit issued under the terms and provisions of this chapter
shall be valid for thirty days from the date of the issuance of such permit,
unless for good cause shown the Building Inspector extends the time of such
permit; provided, however, that there shall be no extension for more than an
additional thirty day period of time. There shall be no additional fee for an
extension of a permit, nor shall there be any refund of a fee for demolition
which does not take place under an issued permit. (Ord. 1977-68. Passed 4-12-
77.)
1323.124 INSPECTION; STOP ORDERS.
   (a)    The Building Inspector or his authorized representative shall make an
inspection of the demolition site prior to issuing a demolition permit. If upon
inspection it is determined that the demolition of an existing structure would
be hazardous to the public health, safety and wellbeing of the general public
during normal working hours, the Building Inspector shall be authorized to
designate the hours during which demolition shall take place, subject, however,
to the condition that no demolition shall be permitted prior to 7:00 a.m. or
later than 5:00 p.m. on any day nor at any time on Sundays or holidays unless
the permit issued by the Building Inspector specifically provides permission
for doing demolition on such days.
   (b)    At any time that the requirements of this chapter are not complied
with by the person, firm or corporation to whom a demolition permit has been
issued, the Building Inspector is authorized to impose a stop order which will
prohibit the continuing demolition of the structure for which the permit has
been issued which stop order shall be effective until such time as the Building
Inspector is satisfied that the terms and provisions of this chapter shall be
complied with. (Ord. 1977-68. Passed 4-12-77.)
1323.125 EXCEPTIONS.
   The terms and provisions of this chapter do not apply to any person razing,
demolishing or tearing down his own building, or any part thereof, if the work
is being done by the person, firm or corporation owning such building, and
provided that such building is not within fifteen feet of any public or private
lands, building or right of way, and also provided that the razing or
demolition of such building is not done by fire, and also provided that such
building does not consist of more than 200 square feet. 
(Ord. 1977-68. Passed 4-12-77.)
1323.126 RIGHT OF APPEAL.
   Any person, firm or corporation aggrieved by any order or decision of the
Building Inspector in his rulings insofar as the application of the terms and
provisions of this chapter are concerned shall have the right of appeal to the
Board of Engineering and Building Appeals of the City, and the Board shall have
full authority to affirm, modify, reverse or set aside any interpretation,
ruling or order of the Building Inspector. (Ord. 1977-68. Passed 4-12-77.)
1323.13 CONDITIONS OF PERMITS.
   All work performed under a permit issued by the Building Inspector shall
conform to the approved application and plans and approved amendments thereto.
   The location of all new construction, as shown on the approved plot or an
approved amendment thereto, shall be strictly adhered to.
   No person shall reduce or diminish the area of a lot or plot of which a plot
plan has been filed and has been used as the basis for a permit unless a
revised plot plan showing the proposed change in conditions has been filed and
approved. However, this shall not apply when the lot is reduced by reason of a
street opening or widening or other public improvement. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-
27-56.)
1323.14 SIGNATURE ON PERMIT.
   Every permit issued by the Building inspector under the provisions of this
Building Code shall have his signature affixed thereto, but this shall not
prevent the Building Inspector from authorizing a subordinate to affix the
Building Inspector's signature.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.15 TIME LIMITS ON PERMITS.
   (a)    Every residential permit issued by the Building Inspector under the
provisions of this Building Code shall contain the following time limits for
completion of work:
 
 
                                           Days
   (1)    Roofs, windows and minor re45irs
   (2)    Additions                  180
   (3)    New home                   365
   (b)    Every commercial permit issued by the Building Inspector under the
provisions of this Building Code shall contain a time limit for completion of
work as determined by the Building Inspector after an inspection of the
submitted plans of a particular job.
(Ord. 1994-106. Passed 11-29-94.)
1323.16 POSTING.
   (a)   A copy of the permit shall be kept on the premises for public
inspection during the prosecution of the work and until the completion of the
same. The Building Inspector may require a certified copy of the approved plans
to be kept on the premises at all times from the commencement of the work to
the completion thereof.
   (b)   All “permitted” jobs must display the hardcopy of the permit toward
the street side of the job or job trailer.
   (c)   All permitted jobs must display a sign, minimum size 2' x 2' with the
contractor’s name, phone number and City license number legibly printed and
posted in front of job facing the street, for the duration of the job.
(Ord. 1994-123. Passed 1-10-95.)
1323.17 REVOCATION.
   The Building Inspector may revoke a permit or approval issued under the
provisions of this Building Code in conformity with Chapter
1335 in case there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to a
material fact in the application or plans upon which the permit or approval was
based.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1323.18 FAILURE TO OBTAIN PERMITS.
      If any work, including new construction, alterations, additions, repair,
electrical, plumbing, heating, air conditioning, etc., is commenced by a
person, firm, corporation or company on a building or structure, whether
residential or commercial, before obtaining the requisite and necessary permits
from the City, all applicable permit fees set out in Chapter
1327 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Steubenville shall be doubled
and payable before said work can continue. The payment of such adjusted permit
fee shall not relieve any person, firm, corporation or company from fully
complying with all the requirements of the City of Steubenville Codes, nor
shall such payment exempt the person, firm, corporation or company from any
other penalty(ies) prescribed within the Codified Ordinances of the City of
Steubenville or elsewhere.
   Within the same calendar year after the first offense, should a person,
firm, corporation or company fail for a second time to obtain a requisite and
necessary permit(s) from the City, all applicable permit fees set out in said
Chapter
1327 shall be increased by five hundred dollars ($500.00) in addition to the
required permit fee and payable before said work can continue. The payment of
such adjusted permit fee shall not relieve any person, firm, corporation or
company from fully complying with all the requirements of the City of
Steubenville Codes, nor shall such payment exempt the person, firm, corporation
or company from any other penalty(ies) prescribed within the Codified
Ordinances of the City of Steubenville or elsewhere.
   Within the same calendar year after the second offense, should a person,
firm, corporation or company fail for a third time to obtain a requisite and
necessary permit(s) from the City, the contractor's license/registration for
that person, firm, corporation or company
shall be revoked for a period of six (6) months.
   Within the same calendar year after the third offense, should a person,
firm, corporation or company fail for a fourth time to obtain a requisite and
necessary permit(s) from the City, the contractor's license/registration for
that person, firm, corporation or company shall be permanently revoked.
   Any person, firm, corporation or company has a right to appeal any decision
of the City relative to this section to the Board of Engineering and Building
Appeals in accordance with Chapter
1329. (Ord. 2022-97. Passed 11-29-22.)
1323.19 CONSTRUCTION NOISE.
   As a condition of earth disturbance and building permit approval,
construction or earth disturbance activity shall not cause noise or sound which
is audible beyond the boundary line of the property where the construction or
earth disturbance activity is taking place between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and
7:00 a.m. prevailing time Monday through Saturday, and no such noise or sound
producing activity shall take place on Sunday, unless approved in advance by
the Building Inspector or where necessary due to an emergency where the health
or safety of persons or property is threatened. The Building Inspector may
impose a stop work order and/or revoke a permit or approval for construction or
earth disturbance activity not in compliance with this section. (Ord. 2006-73.
Passed 8-15-06.)
1323.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: See Section
1335.99 for general Code penalty if no specific penalty is provided.)
CHAPTER 1325
Certificate of Occupancy
1325.01    Applicability; certificate required; fee.
1325.02   Partial, time-limited and temporary structure occupancy.
1325.03   Altered buildings.
1325.04   Information required.
1325.05   Issuance of certificate.
1325.06   Change of occupancy.
1325.07   Occupancy of vacant buildings.
1325.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Permits and certificates in compliance with Zoning Code - see P. & Z.
1135.01,
1135.02
Permits - see BLDG. Ch.
1323
 
1325.01 APPLICABILITY; CERTIFICATE REQUIRED; FEE.
   No person shall occupy or use any erected building, in whole or in part,
until a certificate of occupancy has been issued by the Building Inspector and
posted on the premises certifying that such building conforms to the provisions
of the Building Code, provided that no certificate shall be issued until
written application therefore has been made by the owner of such property to
the Building Inspector, together with such application being accompanied by a
fee in the sum of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per dwelling unit payable to the
City for buildings containing one, two or three family dwellings. For multi-
famiLy residential, commercial and other buildings covered under the Ohio
Building Code (OBC), the fee(s) contained within the OBC shall apply.
(Ord. 2013-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1325.02 PARTIAL, TIME-LIMITED, AND TEMPORARY STRUCTURE OCCUPANCY.
   (a)    Partial Occupancy. Upon written request of the owner of a building,
the Building Inspector may issue a certificate of occupancy before completion
of the entire work provided that the Building Inspector determines that the
space can be safely occupied prior to full completion of the building,
structure, or portion without endangering life or public welfare. The
certificate shall indicate the extent of the areas approved for occupancy and
any time limits for the completion of work.
   (b)    Time-Limited Occupancy. A building or structure hereafter changed in
part from one occupancy to another for a limited time may receive a certificate
of occupancy reflecting that time-limited occupancy provided:
      (1)    There are no violations of laws or orders of the Building
Inspector pending:
      (2)    It is established after inspection and investigation that the
proposed use is not deemed to endanger public safety and welfare:
      (3)    The Building Inspector has approved the use for an alternative
purpose on a temporary basis; and
      (4)    The Building Inspector has issued a certificate of occupancy
indicating any special conditions under which the building or part of the
building can be used for the alternative purpose within the time limit
specified.
   (c)    Temporary Structure Occupancy. A building intended to be erected,
placed and used for a period of time not to exceed 180 consecutive days that
has been determined by the Building Inspector to be in compliance with the
provisions of this Building Code may be issued a certificate of occupancy for
temporary structures. The Building Inspector is authorized to grant extensions
for demonstrated cause.
(Ord. 2013-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1325.03 ALTERED BUILDINGS.
   No building enlarged or extended, or so altered, wholly or in part, as to
change its classification of occupancy, and no building altered for which a
certificate of occupancy has not been issued, shall be occupied or used, in
whole or in part, until a certificate of occupancy has been issued by the
Building Inspector certifying that the work for which the permit was issued has
been completed in accordance with the provisions of this Building Code. If the
occupancy or use of such building was not discontinued during the work of
alteration, the occupancy or use of the building shall not continue for more
than thirty (30) days after completion of the alteration unless such
certificate has been issued
(Ord. 2013-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1325.04 INFORMATION REQUIRED.
   In addition to the certification as to compliance with the provisions of
this Building Code, the certificate of occupancy shall state the purposes for
which the building may be used in its several parts, the maximum permissible
live loads on the several floors, the number of individual persons that may be
accommodated in the several stories, in case such number is limited by a
provision of law or by the permit, and all special stipulations of the permit,
if any. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1325.05 ISSUANCE OF CERTIFICATE.
   A certificate of occupancy shall be issued within seven (7) business days
after written application therefore, if the building at the time of such
application is entitled thereto. Copies of certificates of occupancy shall be
furnished, on request, to persons having a propriety interest in the building.
(Ord. 2013-88. Passed 1-21-14.)
1325.06 CHANGE OF OCCUPANCY.
   No change of occupancy shall be made in a building erected or altered that
is not consistent with the last issued certificate of occupancy for such
building, unless a new certificate of occupancy is secured. No change of
occupancy that would bring a building under some special provisions of this
Building Code shall be made unless the Building Inspector finds, upon
inspection, that such building conforms substantially to the provisions of law
with respect to the proposed new occupancy, and issues a certificate of
occupancy therefor.
   The occupancy of a building shall not be deemed to have changed because of a
temporary vacancy or change of ownership or tenancy. The re-establishment in a
building, after a change of occupancy has been made, of a prior use that would
not have been permitted in a new building of the same type of construction, is
prohibited. No change from a specifically prohibited use to another
specifically prohibited use shall be made.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1325.07 OCCUPANCY OF VACANT BUILDINGS.
   Vacant buildings under Chapter
1199 of the Codified Ordinances shall not be re-occupied until the building and
premises are inspected and a certificate of occupancy is issued by the Building
Inspector pursuant to the requirements of Section
1199.05(c) of the Codified Ordinances.

dollars ($10.00) for residential construction consisting of three (3) or fewer

for any residential consisting of more than three (3) units, commercial,
industrial or other construction covered under the Ohio Building Code (OBC),
which shall be retained by the Building Division even though a building permit
is not granted. (Ord. 2011-69. Passed 9-13-11.)

1329.01 BOARD OF ENGINEERING AND BUILDING APPEALS.
   Continued absence of any member of the Board of Engineering and Building
Appeals from regular meetings of the Board shall render any such member liable
to immediate removal from office. No member of the Board shall pass upon
questions in which he, or any corporation in which he is a shareholder, is
interested. All hearings before the Board shall be open to the public. All
minutes and records shall be public records.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1329.02 APPEALS PROCEDURE.
   Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Building Inspector other than in
enforcement of the Ohio Building Code (OBC), and the head of any agency of the
Municipality, may perfect an appeal to the Board of Engineering and Building
Appeals from such decision. An appeal may be taken within thirty days from the
date of the decision appealed, by filing with the Building Inspector and with
the Board a notice of appeal, specifying the grounds thereof, except that in
the case of a building or structure which, in the opinion of the Building
Inspector, is unsafe or dangerous, the Building Inspector may in his order
limit the time for such appeal to a shorter period. The Building Inspector
shall forthwith transmit to the Board all the papers upon which the action
appealed from was taken.
(Ord. 2011-69. Passed 9-13-11.)
1329.03 MODIFICATIONS AND VARIATIONS.
   The Board of Engineering and Building Appeals, when appealed to and, after a
public hearing, may vary the application of any provision of this Building Code
to any particular case when, in its opinion, the enforcement thereof would do
manifest injustice and would be contrary to the spirit and purpose of this
Building Code or public interest, or when, in its opinion, the interpretation
of the Building Inspector should be modified or reversed.
   A decision of the Board to vary the application of any provision of this
Building Code or to modify an order of the Building Inspector, shall specify in
what manner such variation or modification is made, the conditions upon which
it is made, and the reasons therefor.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1329.04 DECISIONS OF THE BOARD.
   The Board of Engineering and Building Appeals shall in every case reach a
decision without unreasonable or unnecessary delay. Every decision of the Board
shall be in writing and shall indicate the vote upon decision. Every decision
shall be promptly filed in the office of the Building Inspector and shall be
open to public inspection. A certified copy shall be sent by mail or otherwise
to the appellant and a copy shall be kept publicly posted in the office of the
Building Inspector for two weeks after filing.
   If a decision of the Board reverses or modifies a refusal, order or
disallowance of the Building Inspector, or varies the application of any
provision of this Building Code, the Building Inspector shall take action
immediately in accordance with such decision.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1329.05 APPEALS FROM THE BOARD.
   A person aggrieved by a decision of the Board of Engineering and Building
Appeals, whether previously a party to the proceeding or not, or an officer or
board may, within fifteen days after the filing of such decision in the office
of the Building Inspector, apply to an appropriate court to correct errors of
law in such decisions. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56)
1329.06 JURISDICTION OF BOARD.
   In any appeal which is based on a technicality in this Building Code
regarding structural or other matters, the appeal shall be heard by the Board
of Engineering and Building Appeals. If the denial of a building or occupancy
permit is on the grounds of conflict with Zoning Code provisions, then the
appeal shall be heard by the Board of Zoning Appeals.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1329.07 STAYS OF ENFORCEMENT.
   Appeals of notices or orders to the Board of Engineering and Building
Appeals shall stay the enforcement of such notice or order until the appeal is
heard by the Board.
(Ord. 2006-41. Passed 5-23-06.)

1331.01 DIVISION INTO DISTRICTS.
   The territory within the corporate limits of the City shall be divided into
two fire districts as follows:
District No. 1: Commencing at a point where the south line of South Street,
extended, intersects the low water mark of the Ohio River and running thence
west with such south line of South Street to the west line of Seventh Street,
thence north with the west line of Seventh Street to the north line of North
Street, thence east with the north line of North Street, extended, to the low
water mark of the Ohio River, thence south along such low water mark to the
place of beginning.
District No. 2: All territory within the City not set forth in District No. 1.
   (Ord. 7797. Passed 1-31-50.)
1331.02 CONSTRUCTION REQUIREMENTS WITHIN FIRE DISTRICTS.
   (a)    Within Fire District No. 1 all buildings erected or altered shall be
of Type I or Type II, as defined in the Ohio Basic Building Code.
   (b)    With Fire District No. 2 all buildings erected or altered shall be of
Types I, II, III, IV and V, as defined in the Ohio Basic Building Code. (Ord.
1958-171. Passed 12-16-58.)

   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1335.99 general Code penalty if no specific penalty
is provided.)

Violations; Legal and Equitable Remedies

CROSS REFERENCE
   Housing Code notice of violation and penalty - see BLDG. 1363.04, 1363.99
   Right of entry - see BLDG.
1321.09
 
 
1335.01 NOTICE TO CORRECT.
   Whenever the Building Inspector is satisfied that a building or structure or
any work in connection therewith, the erection, construction, alteration,
maintenance or repair of which is regulated, permitted or prohibited by this
Building Code, is being erected, constructed, altered, maintained or repaired
in violation of any of the provisions or requirements of this Building Code, or
in violation of a detailed statement or plan submitted and approved thereunder
or of a permit or certificate issued thereunder, he may serve a written notice
or order upon the person responsible therefor, directing discontinuance of such
illegal action and the remedying of the condition that is in violation of the
provisions or requirements of this Code.
   In case such notice or order is not promptly complied with, the Building
Inspector shall request the Law Director to institute an appropriate action or
proceeding at law or in equity to restrain, correct or remove such violation,
or to prevent the occupation or use of the building or structure involved.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1335.02 EQUITABLE REMEDIES.
   The imposition of the penalty prescribed in Section
1335.99 shall not preclude the Law Director from instituting an appropriate
action or proceeding to prevent an unlawful erection, construction,
reconstruction, alteration, repair, conversion, maintenance or use, or to
restrain, correct or abate a violation, or to prevent the occupancy of a
building, structure or premises, or to prevent an illegal act, conduct,
business or use in or about any premises.
(Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1335.03 OTHER REMEDIES NOT AFFECTED.
   Except where specifically stated in this Building Code, nothing contained in
this chapter shall be construed as abrogating or limiting the administrative
procedure against violations or the penalties prescribed by existing laws and
ordinances. (Ord. 8611. Passed 3-27-56.)
1335.99 GENERAL CODE PENALTY.
        Whoever violates any of the provisions of this Building Code, or fails
to comply with any of the requirements thereof, or erects, constructs, alters
or repairs, or has erected, constructed, altered or repaired, a building or
structure, in violation of a detailed statement or plan submitted and approved
thereunder, or of a permit or certificate issued thereunder, for which no other
penalty is provided, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor in the fourth
degree. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues. The owner of a building, structure or
premises, where anything in violation of this Building Code is placed or
exists, and any architect, builder, contractor, agent, person or corporation
employed in connection therewith and who may have assisted in the commission of
such violation, shall be penalized as herein provided.
(Ord. 2011-69. Passed 9-13-11.)
CHAPTER 1337
